intro: Loasa artemisiifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf loasa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with five petals, and it produces fluffy, seed-bearing capsules. Loasa artemisiifolia is known for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
